main_definition: Meta refers to a concept or discussion that is an abstraction from, or a commentary on, the subject itself.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Concerning elements that are abstracted from other things
meanings_and_examples.example: The meta-data about a document includes its title and author.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relating to or denoting the act of analyzing something in terms of itself
meanings_and_examples.example: This movie is a meta commentary on the film genre it parodies.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Reflecting upon one's own work, ideas, etc.
meanings_and_examples.example: The author provided a meta-analysis of his previous novels to show growth in his writing style.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Referring to the data or information that describes other data
meanings_and_examples.example: Metadata can include details like file size, date created, and type of format.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Characterizing something as being a higher-level concept than itself
meanings_and_examples.example: The plot of the story is meta because it self-referentially comments on storytelling techniques.
